result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez.  Prosecuting attorney Gregg Herman in court for the State of Wisconsin. Sworn as interpreter,  Judy Veramendi.  Defense informed the Court State was still drafting DPA agreement. State confirmed. Case adjourned for Deferred Prosecution Agreement, Branch 30.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for December 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez in court.  Attorney Patrick Dennis Wait in court for Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez.  Prosecuting attorney M Samir Siddique in court for the State of Wisconsin. Deputy court clerk cmt. 
Case scheduled for DPA hearing. Court in trial with another matter and orders case adjourned.
Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 02:00 pm.

Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Sworn as interpreter: Kelley Salas. 
Case in court for status conference. Defense requests DPA resolution date. Defense counsel requested for interpretation services be provided for the purposes of discussing the case with the defendant, granted by the Court. Case adjourned to Branch 30.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Case rescheduled due to court congestion.  Status conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez in court with attorney Patrick Dennis Wait.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for pre-trial conference. Due to the need for a Spanish interpreter, Court orders case adjourned. 
Case remains calendared in Br 30.  Status conference scheduled for July 28, 2022 at 10:30 am.

No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
DEFENDANT WAS ORDERED BY THE COURT TO REPORT TO THE MILWAUKEE COUNTY JAIL (CJF) TO BE BOOKED AND RELEASED BY 5:00 P.M. ON 06-10-2022. IF THEY FAIL TO APPEAR A BENCH WARRANT WILL BE ISSUED FOR THEIR ARREST.

Defendant advised that this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant. Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 right to challenge probable cause and to have complaint read until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. Defendant IS Public Defender eligible. Defendant is ordered to provide the public defender's office with the next court date.  
The case is adjourned to Br. 30 for a Pretrial Conference.

Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez in court.  Alexander C. Dyer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Sworn as interpreter: Kelley Salas.
Court ordered arrest warrant withdrawn.  Recall issued.
  Pre-trial conference scheduled for July 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Juan Manuel Rivera-Jimenez not in court.  David T. Malone appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 05/26/2022@2p
